predicate.note: Frames file for 'conceive' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry, Framenet entries Awareness and Invention.

example.name: oddly transitive
example.text: Market segmentation in cars isn't new, but it's far more extensive than when Alfred P. Sloan Jr. conceived the idea 50 years ago.

example.name: more typically prepositional
example.text: Try as they might, they just can't conceive of life without black workers.

example.name: with attribute
example.text: The restaurant was conceived *trace* as a sparkling, crystalline ``geode.''

roleset.name: make babies

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Some women clearly have no trouble *trace* eventually conceiving again: The studies have reported repeaters in their programs.

roleset.note: This sense could take an object, probably, which would be the baby.
